snippet: The municipality was accused of misstating or omitting relevant information about its troubled finances in reports and statements.
abstract: Securities and Exchange Commission accuses Harrisburg, Pennsylvania's debt-laden capital, of violating federal antifraud rules for securities issuers by repeatedly giving misleading information that created risks for bond investors as city's finances were rapidly deteriorating.
lead_paragraph: The municipality was accused of misstating or omitting relevant information about its troubled finances in reports and statements.

headline.seo: S.E.C. Says Harrisburg, Pa., Misled Its Bond Investors
headline.main: S.E.C. Contends Harrisburg, Pa., Misled Its Bond Investors
headline.print_headline: S.E.C. Contends Harrisburg, Pa., Misled Its Bond Investors
